intro: Cistanthe guadalupensis, commonly known as the Guadalupine cistanthe, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. This herbaceous perennial is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in its habitat.
